events.title: Gunmen have killed at least 162 people in west Nigeria attack, says Red Cross

events.title: The people betting on catastrophic world events â€“ podcast
events.description: Prediction markets allow you to put money on everything from the US attacking Iran to Jesus returning. Saahil Desai explains their dizzying rise In the early hours of 3 January, Donald Trump ordered a surprise attack on the Venezuelan capital, Caracas, to kidnap the countryâ€™s leader, NicolÃ¡s Maduro. Millions of Venezuelansâ€™ lives were thrown into uncertainty. Politicians at home and abroad scrambled to respond. It seemed this was something no one had seen coming. Except one person did actually predict it. In the hours before the attack, someone - and we have no way of knowing who - placed a series of bets that Donald Trump would oust Maduro on a prediction market platform, netting them nearly $500,000 when it happened. These platforms allow their users not just to bet on whoeverâ€™s going to win the Super Bowl, but also on world events. Heavily regulated under the Biden administration, these apps have enjoyed a huge boom in popularity since Trump came to power. Continue reading...

events.title: U.K. police investigating Peter Mandelson over Jeffrey Epstein email leak claims
events.description: Peter Mandelson, the United Kingdom's former ambassador to Washington, is being investigated over claims he leaked sensitive government information to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: The U.K. investigates its ex-ambassador to the U.S. over alleged leaks to Epstein
events.description: The U.K. government says newly released files related to Jeffrey Epstein suggest that the former British ambassador to the U.S. may have shared market-sensitive information with Epstein.

events.title: Takeaways from the latest Epstein files. And, police search for Savannah Guthrie's mom
events.description: NPR analyzes the latest Jeffrey Epstein files. And, Arizona authorities launched an urgent search for Savannah Guthrie's 84-year-old mother, Nancyafter a suspected home abduction.

events.title: Serbia: Reform denounced as a political takeover of justice
events.description: In a rushed, opaque procedure, Serbia's ruling majority has pushed through legal amendments that critics say undermine judicial independence and are designed to neutralize the prosecutors investigating organized crime.

events.title: Tiny dinosaur fossil could provide evolutionary clues: study
events.description: Scientists have said fossils of a small newly discovered dinosaur found in Spain could change ideas on the evolution of ornithopods.

events.title: Moltbook: Viral site for AI agents explodes into mainstream
events.description: Can a viral site where AI assistants discuss technical workflows and the end of humanity change the way we think about AI?

events.title: Fact check: How videos are recycled for political purposes
events.description: Old images, current crises: DW shows how recycling old content works, and how you can quickly recognize disinformation and build media literacy.

events.title: Germany news: Merz starts Gulf trip with Saudi Arabia visit
events.description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz is set to talk energy, arms and diplomacy as he embarks on a three-day trip to Saudi Arabia, Qatar and the UAE. Back in Germany, airline Lufthansa is investigating its Nazi past. DW has more.

events.title: India's oil shake-up: Can Venezuela really replace Russia?
events.description: Donald Trump says India has agreed to replace Russian oil with US supplies â€” and maybe even Venezuelan. DW asks whether the Latin American producer can realistically meet New Delhi's needs.

events.title: Trump renews lapsed trade subsidy pact with Africa
events.description: First enacted in 2000, the African Growth and Opportunity Act (AGOA) allows qualifying sub-Saharan African countries to export over 1,800 products to the US duty-free. Export countries include Nigeria and South Africa.

events.title: US: Trump signs bill ending partial government shutdown
events.description: The budget package secures funding for most US government agencies until the end of September, except for the Department of Homeland Security.

events.title: 'Iran's Revolutionary Guards converted to a monster,' co-founder Mohsen Sazegara says
events.description: In an interview with FRANCE 24, the co-founder of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC), the exiled dissident Mohsen Sazegara, said the organisation has "converted to a monster" and is the "backbone of keeping the dictator in power," referring to Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei.

events.title: US partial government shutdown ends, but DHS funding fight looms
events.description: A deal between Senate Democrats and President Donald Trump has ended a short-lived partial US government shutdown, but funding for the Department of Homeland Security remains up in the air as lawmakers push for reforms to ICE and Border Patrol. Also in this edition: the EU seeks a partnership with Washington on critical rare earth minerals.

events.title: 'I still would like to meet Putin': Epstein's unrequited love for Russian leader

events.title: Son of former Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi shot dead
events.description: Saif al Islam Gaddafi, the son of Libya's late dictator Muammar Gaddafi, has been shot dead by gunmen who broke into his home, officials have said.

events.title: Teenage boy swims for four hours to save family swept out to sea
events.description: A 13-year-old Australian boy has described battling "massive" waves to swim around four hours to shore and raise the alarm after his family were swept out to sea.

events.title: French investigators raid Paris offices of Elon Musk's X
events.description: Investigators have raided the Paris offices of Elon Musk's social media site X, formerly known as Twitter.

events.title: Son of Norway's crown princess denies rape as trial begins
events.description: The trial of the eldest son of Norway's crown princess on charges including rape has begun, after a set of new allegations were made against him.

events.title: Philippine lawmakers find bid to impeach Marcos to be 'insufficient in substance'

events.title: Serbian government official faces forgery trial over withdrawn Kushner-linked project
events.description: A Serbian government minister and three others are on trial for abuse of office and document falsification

events.description: The reopening of the Rafah crossing in the southern Gaza Strip on Monday after more than a year is being met with both optimism and fear, a senior official with the UN agency that assists the Palestinian people, UNRWA, has said.

events.title: US military shoots down Iranian drone approaching USS Abraham Lincoln in Arabian Sea, official says
events.description: The U.S. military shot down an Iranian drone after it "aggressively approached a U.S. Navy aircraft carrier with unclear intent," a CENTCOM spokesman said.

events.title: Australian teen swims 2.5 miles for hours to save family swept out to sea
